title: Is Viral Loop worth reading? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey, I'm the founder of KickoffLabs... a lead generation SaaS with built-in viral features. Wanted to chime in with some other book recommendations by one of our customers utilizing the "Viral Loop" and other psychological methods for a successful launch: Start With Why will inspire you to do things that inspire people. If you don’t fancy reading the whole thing he’s got a Ted Talk that sums it up in 5 minutes:   Contagious by Jonah Berger is a very good book. It runs through all the different ways in which you can make an idea spread, like making something very visible so other people can talk about it. The Viral Startup: A Guide to Designing Viral Loops by Andrew Chen is more like a blog into a book, which is pretty good. If you want to read about specifics and examples on growth hack techniques our customer used... read the success story here: How to Secure 300,000 Fans, 50,000 Emails, & Crowdfunding Thanks,Josh LedgardFounder - KickoffLabsSmarter Landing Pages, Opt-in Forms, & Email Marketing
I thought it was a good read, especially if you are new to the viral loop world. As Peter Clark says, if you really want to dive into the subject there is much more to be found online.
